MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT

Services

Detroit, MI 48207-4635

License Expiration Date: 01/31/2025

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Staff qualifications; volunteer, contractors on central registry.
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12206
Section (2) A staff member must be of responsible character and suitable
Description and able to meet the needs of children and families served by the
agency.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation The worker and supervisor threatened to kill the foster child.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant: I made several attempts to reach the Complainant
for an interview without success. During one contact,
Complainant hung up on me and in others Complainant did not
return my contact to them.
Chief Administrator and Section Manager: I spoke with Chief
Administrator and Section Manager during a TEAMS entrance
contact on 7/10/2024. They advised that the supervisor named in
this complaint, Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) 1 is no longer
employed with the agency as of March 2024. Foster Care Worker
(FCW) 1 who is named in the complainant is still employed with
the agency, but she has not been assigned to Child A’s or the
sibling’s case since 5/16/2023.
Section Manager reported the case was transferred from FCW 1
due to FCW 1 having a PPO (Personal Protection Order) against
the birthmother, who was threatening FCW 1 and FCW 1 going on
medical leave. The case was assigned to FCW 2 for two weeks,
then to FCW 3 until the case was closed. Section Manager
reported Child A was already placed in the legal father’s home
and on 8/10/2023 the court legally ordered that placement. The
court order was signed 9/1/2023.
Section Manager reported FCW 2 is on medical leave but FCW 1
and FCS 2 are available to speak with me about the allegations.
2

FCW 1: I interviewed FCW 1 by telephone on 7/15/2024. FCW 1
denied ever threatening the child or birth mother. She affirmed
Section Manager’s reporting related to her obtaining a PPO and
the case being transferred from her and why. She reported there
was no threat to the birth mother by her, FCS 1 or anyone. She
reported the threats were from the birth mother toward her. The
birth mother was very confrontational and was making threats to
her via email. FCW 1 said she went on medical leave from
5/20/2023 and when she returned on 11/20/2023 the case was
closed.
FCS 2: I interviewed FCS 2 by telephone on 7/18/2024. She was
not aware of any threats to the foster child or birth mother by any
foster care staff. She affirmed staff’s assignment of the case as
reported by Section Manager. She reported both FCW 2 and FCW
3 are on leave of absence now and this case was closed out in
September 2023 due the judge giving full custody to the birth
father who had placement of Child A.
FCS 2 reported when the child’s case was under her supervision,
she primarily had the contacts with the birth mother due to the
birth mother’s making threats to workers. She reported during her
contacts with the birth mother, the birth mother would bring up
FCW 1. Such as FCW 1 did not like her, or FCW 1 did not provide
her services, but never that FCW 1 threatened her, or threatened
to harm Child A.
Documentation Review:
Child A’s MISACWIS case record which showed:
• Child A entered care on 9/8/2020 and was placed with her
nonrespondent legal father on 9/3/2021.
• A DHS-69 Foster Care Action Summary dated 9/12/2023
completed by FCW 3 that showed Child A’s foster care
case closure for an 8/10/2023 effective date.
Analysis Based on information from interviews and documentation
reviewed, the evidence does not substantiate the allegations or a
lack of responsible character by the staff suitable and able to meet
the needs of children and families served by the agency.
Conclusion Violation Not Established.
Rule Code Privacy safeguard
Title
Rule Code & CPA Rule 400.12211
Section (1) An agency shall safeguard the privacy of a child and his or her
Description family.
3

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation.
Type
Allegation The worker gave confidential information about the birth mother,
such as social security number, to other people outside the
agency.
Investigation Interviews:
Complainant: I made several attempts to reach the Complainant
for an interview without success. During one contact,
Complainant hung up on me and in others Complainant did not
return my contact to them.
Chief Administrator and Section Manager: I spoke with Chief
Administrator and Section Manager during a TEAMS entrance
contact on 7/10/2024. They advised that the supervisor named in
this complaint, Foster Care Supervisor (FCS) 1 is no longer
employed with the agency as of March 2024. Foster Care Worker
(FCW) 1 who is named in the complainant is still employed with
the agency, but she has not been assigned to Child A’s or the
sibling’s case since 5/16/2023.
Section Manager reported the case was transferred from FCW 1
due to FCW 1 having a PPO (Person Protection Order) against
the birthmother, who was threatening FCW 1; and FCW 1 going
on medical leave. The case was assigned to FCW 2 for two
weeks, then to FCW 3 until the case was closed. Section
Manager reported Child A was already placed in the legal father’s
home and on 8/10/2023 the court legally ordered that placement.
That court order was signed 9/1/2023.
Neither Chief Administrator nor Section Manager were aware of
confidential information related to the birth parents or this case
being inappropriately shared.
FCW 1: I interviewed FCW 1 by telephone on 7/15/2024. FCW 1
denied the allegation. She reported no contact with the birth
mother since sometime in May 2023 prior to her medical leave on
5/20/2023. She reported there were no reports or documents that
she would have written to anyone or provided to service providers
that would have contained the birth mother’s social security
number or protective confidential information.
FCS 2: I interviewed FCS 2 by telephone on 7/18/2024. She was
not aware of confidential information, such as social security
numbers related to the birth mother being released or provided to
anyone inappropriately.
4

Analysis Based on information from interviews the evidence does not
substantiate the allegation or that the privacy of the child and his
or her family was not safeguarded.
Conclusion Violation Not Established.
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
August 21, 2024
______________________________________
Lonia Perry Calloway Date
Licensing Consultant
